channel.title: Great Smoky Mountains National Park Audio Blog -- Smokies, Smokey Mountains, Gatlinburg -- Animal & Ghost Stories
channel.copyright: © 2008 Great Smoky Mountains Association, Gatlinburg, TN
channel.description: Free audio podcasts from Great Smoky Mountains National Park featuring auto tours, animal stories, ghost stories, bear bloopers, natural and cultural history, and comedy from the park's official nonprofit partner, Great Smoky Mountains Association.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Smokies Sounds
channel.itunes:keywords: Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Smokies, Smokey Mountains, Gatlinburg, hiking, camping, travel, guides, maps, vacation, trip plans
channel.itunes:author: Great Smoky Mountains Association

item.title: Audio Driving Tour: Newfound Gap to Oconoluftee, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.description: Narration and music for your drive from Newfound Gap to Oconoluftee, NC, in Great Smoky Mountains National Park.

item.title: Audio Driving Tour: Sugarlands to Newfound Gap, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.description: Narration and music for your drive from the Sugarlands Visitor Center to Newfound Gap in Great Smoky Mountains National Park.

item.title: Audio Driving Tour: Newfound Gap to Sugarland Visitors Center, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.description: Narration and music for your drive from Newfound Gap to the Sugarland Visitors Center in Great Smoky Mountains National Park.

item.title: Audio Driving Tour: Oconaluftee to Newfound Gap, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.description: Narration and music for your drive from Oconaluftee, NC, to Newfound Gap in Great Smoky Mountains National Park.

item.title: Catfish by Doug Elliott
item.description: An amusing song about catfish and assorted other animals by Doug Elliott, www.dougelliott.com

item.title: Blackberry Boogie by Doug Elliott
item.description: Try to solve an old Appalachian folk riddle, enjoy a story, and hear a charming ditty, www.dougelliott.com

item.title: A Cabin on Fire, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.description: Mysterious mountain legend about a man who wrote prophetic poetry while sleeping. Read by Don G. Campbell and Carey Jones.

item.title: Rachel, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.description: An elderly mountain woman has a vision that explains her past just before she dies. Read by Joey Heath.

item.title: Snowy Footprints, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.description: A young boy is saved when his rescuer is led to him by mysterious footprints. Read by Carey Jones.

item.title: Bumbling Bushwhacker's Theory of Relativity, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.description: The Bushwhacker contemplates danger while hiking in the Smokies. Read by Carolyn Jourdan.

item.title: Bird Brain, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.description: Wilderness audio expert struggles to record bird sounds in the Smokies. Read by Carolyn Jourdan.

item.title: Commiserate with Tommy Hunke: Appalachian Trail Thru-Hiker or Just Through Hiking?
item.itunes:author: Great Smoky Mountains Association.
item.description: Hiking the AT in a Walmart rain poncho. Read by Carolyn Jourdan.

item.title: Be Inspired by Betty Kelly: Hiking the Appalachian Trail at Age 64
item.itunes:author: Great Smoky Mountains Association.
item.description: The adventures of a retired hairdresser hiking the AT. Read by Carolyn Jourdan.

item.title: Falling and Crawling to Record that Bird Call, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.itunes:author: Mark Dunaway and Great Smoky Mountains Association
item.description: The hardships of a wilderness audio recordist in the Smokies. Told by Mark Dunaway.

item.title: Tough Days Chasing Birds With a Microphone, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.itunes:author: Mark Dunaway and Great Smoky Mountains Association
item.description: Bloopers from a frustrated wilderness audio recordist in the Smokies. Told by Mark Dunaway.

item.title: Scream of the Sound Recordist Accidentally Recorded in the Wild, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.itunes:author: Mark Dunaway and Great Smoky Mountains Association
item.description: Goofy moments with a wilderness audio recordist in the Smokies. Scream by Mark Dunaway.

item.title: The Post Hole Digger from "Heart in the Right Place"
item.itunes:author: Carolyn Jourdan
item.description: Hilarious true story about a farming accident told to a Smoky Mountains receptionist, Carolyn Jourdan.

item.title: Introducing Kim Delozier, Ranger and Bear Expert, Great Smoky Mountains National Park
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: Introduction of Smokies Supervisory Wildlife Biologist. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.title: Black Bear Density in Relation to Tourists in the Smokies
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: General background information about black bears in the Smokies. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.title: Natural History of Black Bears in the Smokies
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: Natural history information about black bears in the Smokies. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.title: How Wild Bears Lose Their Fear of People
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: How bears become food-conditioned and how to cope with them. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.title: The 3 Types of Bear Feeding Behaviors
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: How to determine what sort of bear you are dealing with. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.title: How Close Can We Get to Bears and Be Safe?
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: Any distance which disturbs the bear is too close. Never go closer than 50 yards. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.title: Who You Gonna Call?
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: What to do if you see a bear outside a park cabin. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.title: What If You See a Bear on Private Property?
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: What to do if you see a bear on private property. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.title: Don't Run
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: Don't try to run away from a bear or escape by climbing a tree. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.title: Bear Blooper 1: Can I get a ride?
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: Dangerous animal transportation practices. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier

item.title: The Troublesome Cub

item.description: Cub gets into an nutty situation. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: Amazing navigational skills of bears. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.title: Bear Blooper # 2: What Happens When a Bear Wakes Up in Your Office?
item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: Picture a "sedated" bear waking up prematurely in your office. Narrated by Kim Delozier.

item.itunes:author: Kim Delozier
item.description: Ranger tries to rescue a cub trapped at the top of a spindly tree. Narrated by Kim Delozier.
